column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3 .
#Text=Discussion
#Text=Urine is a vital biofluid in mammals and could be easily collected in a noninvasive manner .
#Text=Moreover , the metabolites components and concentrations in urine are good indicators of metabolic fluctuations .
#Text=Comparison of metabolite profiles between the treatment group and the control group could obtain metabolic changes and reveal adverse effects mechanism of stressor .
#Text=In this study , 1H-NMR and UPLC-MS/MS based metabolomics were employed to investigate the metabolic perturbations after rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M exposure .
#Text=The results showed that both rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M induced systematic metabolic changes in urine and serum .
#Text=Rac

#Text=-metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M induced liver damages and metabolic pathway changes including glycine , serine , and threonine metabolism , citrate cycle ( TCA cycle ) , pyruvate metabolism , glycolysis or gluconeogenesis , glycerophospholipid metabolism , and glyoxylate and dicarboxylate metabolism .
#Text=These pathways are highly related to energy metabolism , lipid metabolism , amino acids metabolism , microbial metabolism , and tryptophan metabolism .
#Text=3.1 .
#Text=Body Weight Changes and Liver Damage
#Text=Only one mouse was dead in the 60 mg/kg metalaxyl-M treatment group during the whole experiment .
#Text=After four weeks of exposure , no significant changes in body weight were observed between the control and treatment groups after rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M exposure .
#Text=Histopathology examination showed that rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M can both induce hepatocellular inflammation , necrosis , and vacuolation in mice .
#Text=Such results suggested rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M exposure caused liver dysfunction in mice .
#Text=Moreover , metalaxyl-M induced greater liver damage than rac -metalaxyl at the same dosage .
#Text=The liver is a fundamental and essential organ for metabolism and detoxification of xenobiotics with abundant cytochrome P450 enzymes .
#Text=The damages of the liver may greatly affect the detoxification of mice .
#Text=3.2 .
#Text=Energy Metabolism

#Text=Metabolites involved in energy metabolism were significant changed in mice urine after rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M exposure , including citrate , succinate , lactate , alanine , pyruvate , and acetate .
#Text=These metabolites are highly related to energy pathways , including the TCA cycle , pyruvate metabolism , and glycolysis or gluconeogenesis .
#Text=Citrate and succinate are the main intermediates in the TCA cycle , which is mainly appeared in liver mitochondria .

#Text=Although other factors cannot be excluded , the increased levels of citrate and succinate in the urine of metalaxyl-M-treated mice indicated that metalaxyl-M affected the activity of mitochondria enzymes involved in the TCA cycle , resulting in the enhancement of energy metabolism in treated mice .
#Text=In addition , the decreased level of pyruvate and increased levels of lactate and alanine were highly related to pyruvate metabolism .
#Text=Pyruvate could be converted to acetyl-coenzyme A ( COA ) , which is a vital intermediate in the synthesis of citrate .
#Text=Lactate and alanine can also be converted to pyruvate .
#Text=Thus , the increased lactate and alanine could promote the level of acetyl-COA and then up-regulate the energy metabolism .
#Text=To sum up , these results indicated the enhancement of energy metabolism in mice after rac -metalaxyl and metalaxyl-M exposure .
#Text=Furthermore , the perturbation degrees induced by metalaxy-M were higher than rac -metalaxy in energy metabolism .
#Text=3.3 .
#Text=Lipid Metabolism
#Text=In this study , metalaxyl-M induced two lipid metabolism pathway fluctuations including glycerophospholipid metabolism , glyoxylate , and dicarboxylate metabolism .
#Text=However , no lipid metabolism pathway was affected by rac -metalaxyl exposure .
#Text=According to metabolomics data , metalaxyl-M induced the increased levels of choline and TMAO and decreased levels of PC and GPC .
#Text=Rac
#Text=-metalaxyl only induced the decreased level of GPC .
#Text=Such metabolites were all related to lipid metabolism and had essential effect on cholesterol level in digestive system .
#Text=Choline is an important nutrient that is required for lipid transport , methyl-group metabolism , neurotransmitter synthesis , cell membrane structure , and signaling .
#Text=In addition , choline is a constituent of cell membranes and lipoprotein phospholipids , which play an important role in the integrity of cell membrane and lipid metabolism .

#Text=Increased choline levels in urine samples suggested the membrane fluidity was disrupted by metalaxyl-M . PC and GPC are known to be important endogenous metabolites related to maintenance of choline homeostasis and bile acids excretion .
#Text=Moreover , PC , and GPC are not only essential components of cell membranes , but also protect cell from oxidative stress and lipotoxicity .
#Text=The decreased levels of PC and GPC may be good indicators of oxidative stress and lipotoxicity induced by metalaxyl-M .
